title: 2-year-old struck by gunfire while at table with family
content:
DETROIT -- Police say a 2-year-old girl was struck by a bullet while sitting at a table with relatives Sunday.
Detroit Police Officer Nicole Kirkwood said the girl was hospitalized in temporarily serious condition and is expected to survive.
She "was in the home with relatives when gunshots were heard outside," Kirkwood said. " ... Apparently, one of the shots came in through the wall ended up striking the little girl in the body."
WDIV-TV, Channel 4 News reports she was struck in the buttocks.
Kirkwood said a motive hasn't been released and no suspects have been arrested but the shooting remains under investigation.
The shooting took place on the 6000 block of Crane in east Detroit.
Two children, 3-year-old Aiyana Montgomery and 6-month-old Miracle Murray, died earlier this year after being struck by bullets in two separate shootings.
Police previously said there was a "gang nexus" to each of those shootings and the killing of Miracle Murray, who was shot in the back while in a stroller outside her father's Detroit home, might have been retaliation for the killing of Aiyana.
Four people -- one who committed suicide in jail -- were arrested in the shooting of Aiyana.
Detroit police initially arrested two men in connection with the Miracle case but later released them without charges and said they are still investigating.
